basics.name: Briana Lee
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently pursuing both a Bachelor’s and Master’s degree in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa an expected graduation in Spring 2026.

work.summary: Local company that develops software for aerospace exploration.
highlights: Developed and optimized software solutions for data processing and analysis related to space missions, collaborating closely with team members.

work.summary: Summer Fellowship that connects college students to national security problems in DoD.
highlights: Worked with the U.S. Department of Defense to address real-world national security challenges.

work.company: Native Hawaiian Science and Engineering Mentorship Program
work.summary: Program that provides opportunities to students in STEM.
highlights: Assisted the management team with administrative tasks and special projects as needed.
Enhanced efficiency in program operations, allowing the team to focus on strategic initiatives and expand outreach efforts.

volunteer.summary: A Registered Independent Organization (RIO) at the University of Hawaii that offers college student-lead coding youth programs
highlights: Mentor 6-12 grade students in 3-month courses about the fundamentals of web development
Fall 2023- Research funded by ChangeHI National Science Foundation's EPSCoR Data Outcomes Collection System (EDOCS)
Spring 2024, Fall 2024 - Research funded by UHM Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program

awards.title: AFCEA Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen, college students, teachers, and organizations in order to enhance STEM Education in Hawaii.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to students who have earned a semester GPA of 3.0 or higher based on ~12 credits.
